result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Assignment of Judge - Returned - Return to Sender - Not Deliverable as Addressed - Unable to Forward.
Effective August 3, 2020, this case is assigned to Branch 5, the Honorable J. Arthur Melvin, pursuant to 20-SO-01(67).
Filed by Atty. Michael Reyes - Stating he no longer represents the defendant and requesting his name be removed as attorney of record.
EXT Code #1

Attorney Michael Reyes in court by phone.   Defendant Mylah S Hatchett did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case scheduled for 9:30 am; matter called at 10:29 am.  Court notes the matter was set for plea and sentencing.  Atty. Reyes presents statements.  Court verifies that the defendant is not here today.  Atty. Reyes presents additional statements to the with court with regards to his contact with the defendant.  State is requesting a capias be issued and bail be revoked or forfeited.  Court to issue a capias and orders bail be revoked.
